channel.title: XEN Texture donation and assistance.
channel.description:
Hi, my name is Deadity, I have been a texture artist for the now deceased Half-Life 2 mod called Dreamscape. I am now doing a mod for Crysis which is very early in development.
Not sure if this is the correct place to post this. I would like to give a texture I have made to the development team. And offer to make more of them, if wanted. I noticed from this [url='https://www.atomicmpc.com.au/Feature/230583,is-black-mesa-the-ultimate-half-life-2-mod.aspx']article[/url] that some XEN textures aren't done yet. I have made this texture today. And the team can have it if they want (for free obviously). I only wish to be credited somehow for my work. If the team doesn't want the texture then there is no need to reply to me. Just ignore this post. And if someone else want's it then contact me or reply to this thread.
The texture includes a Diffuse-, Specular-, Height- and normalmap. I couldn't get SSbump/Normal Generator to work, that is why the height- and normalmaps are separate.
The textures are made in Photoshop. And as I said I can make more if needed.
Here is a preview of the textures:
![](upload://vaufWd7O2cI5uytxDnA16USxCq7.jpeg)
Preview of the normalmap on a sphere.
![](upload://uypEMySf7caIJXLK5JbMo2SrQZB.jpeg)
Preview of the normalmap on a wall.
![](upload://iy5HOJAl13RrlyGaVz0V6z9G3vA.jpeg)
Diffuse.
EDIT: I was going for the wall texture in this screenshot. It's pretty close to the original, even if I do say so myself.
[img]https://media.giantbomb.com/uploads/1/12384/648986-c4a1b0009_super.jpg[/img]

item.title: XEN Texture donation and assistance.
item.dc:creator: Eric_Fong
item.description:
MysticJ:

Do you realize that you’re posting as a forum post what should be in your portfolio’s motivation letter?

Keep your trademarks or creative secrets private, I recommend.

And do what CatzEyes recommended – look at the JOBS page and submit your application. Otherwise, you’d have to wait for a community project to submit “voluntary work”, but there’s not gonna be any community project about xen, sorry.

And you do not have to repeat anything that someone post early.

Read full topic

item.title: XEN Texture donation and assistance.
item.dc:creator: MysticJ
item.description:
Deadity:

I actually like my second texture more. I think you need to see it in game to get the full effect of it. I think it captures the original intent of how XEN was supposed to look by Valve. It looks like looking at fungus through a microscope, yet it’s big enough to touch. And it looks completely organic and alive. I noticed the development team used Zbrush to make textures for XEN. The problem of sculpting textures in Zbrush in my humble opinion is that it looks sculpted and not very organic. I try to use a more pixel based approach.

Do you realize that you’re posting as a forum post what should be in your portfolio’s motivation letter?

Keep your trademarks or creative secrets private, I recommend.

And do what CatzEyes recommended – look at the JOBS page and submit your application. Otherwise, you’d have to wait for a community project to submit “voluntary work”, but there’s not gonna be any community project about xen, sorry.

Read full topic

item.title: XEN Texture donation and assistance.
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
CatzEyes93:

I hope you arent putting words in my mouth. I dont think it is unreasonable to say that if you want to contribute actual work to the mod, you need to be on the team. Thus the reason I offered a link to the page where he can apply for a job.

For what it’s worth, I knew where you were going with that.

Should we make out now, or make out later?

item.title: XEN Texture donation and assistance.
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
Dr. Karamazov:

Nice textures Deadity.
Don’t worry too much about the passive aggressive nature of some of the board members, this is just how they are. There’s a fair amount of elitism here.

But judging by the Dev responce, they don’t want them.

I hope you arent putting words in my mouth. I dont think it is unreasonable to say that if you want to contribute actual work to the mod, you need to be on the team. Thus the reason I offered a link to the page where he can apply for a job.

item.title: XEN Texture donation and assistance.
item.dc:creator: Deadity
item.description:
Narfin:

I’m surprised you haven’t been approached in a warmer manner. That first texture is awesome! (I’m not too hot about the second one though )

I actually like my second texture more. I think you need to see it in game to get the full effect of it. I think it captures the original intent of how XEN was supposed to look by Valve. It looks like looking at fungus through a microscope, yet it’s big enough to touch. And it looks completely organic and alive. I noticed the development team used Zbrush to make textures for XEN. The problem of sculpting textures in Zbrush in my humble opinion is that it looks sculpted and not very organic. I try to use a more pixel based approach.

Read full topic

item.title: XEN Texture donation and assistance.
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
mattemuse:

FYI the Xen screens released by Atomic PC aren’t “missing” any textures, according to the BM Dev Team they intentionally blacked out Xen because they want it to be a surprise.

i take that back, since the build review was unplanned it is likely that xen is in fact missing materials

Read full topic
